definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear

sentences.english: Blend oils and then add to a bowl of steaming water and inhale for five minutes.
sentences.chinese: 混合油，然后添加到一碗热气腾腾的水和吸入五分钟。

sentences.english: And later she would have a cup of hot coffee, coffee with cinnamon.
sentences.chinese: 然后再喝上一杯热气腾腾的咖啡，加了香料的那种。

sentences.english: It looked at the cart of steaming hot bean cakes, people just want to pay.
sentences.chinese: 看着推车上那热气腾腾的豆糕，让人只想掏钱。

sentences.english: If you put hot food in the icebox, the ice might melt.
sentences.chinese: 如果你把热气腾腾的食物放入冰盒，冰块会融化。

sentences.english: Along with them came a big, steaming bowl of peas.
sentences.chinese: 和它们一起的，还有一大碗热气腾腾的豌豆。

sentences.english: Dishes of bouillon were brought in hot and hot.
sentences.chinese: 一道道热气腾腾的肉汤被端上来了。

sentences.english: If you buy ready-to-eat, hot food, make sure it's served steaming hot.
sentences.chinese: 如果你买现成的吃，热食，确保它的服务热气腾腾。

sentences.english: Gabrielle liked her paella piping hot.
sentences.chinese: 她总想让她的肉菜闷饭热气腾腾。

sentences.english: Now, I am gonna make a steaming cup of compost tea.
sentences.chinese: 现在，我要泡杯热气腾腾的肥料茶。

sentences.english: Two china jugs held steaming gravy.
sentences.chinese: 两个瓷罐子装着热气腾腾的肉卤。

definition: variant of 熱乎乎|热乎乎[re4 hu1 hu1]
